intro: Themistoclesia pennellii, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many vines and climbing plants. The plant is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, showy flowers that range in color from white to purple, often opening in the morning. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are twining and can grow quite long. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
